reviews.sentence: poor shuttle service good happy hour. We felt as if we were treated like second class citizens when taking the shuttle to the airport. We were there first then a bunch of airline employees came. They took the airline personnel before us making two of the three of us wait for another shuttle. We did however enjoy the half price drinks and appetizers during happy hour.

Okay hotel for annual conference clean polite. I have come here for a conference 8 out of the last 10 years. It is always clean. The staff is polite friendly and helpful. The rooms with 2 queens are really double beds. The airport is very close by and noisy except between about 10 PM 6 AM. There is a convenient free shuttle to from the airport. This hotel is rather old and shows that it has been renovated multiple times. The restaurant in the hotel is good but pricey. I fly in just for conferences so I never have a car it is not very convenient for walking anywhere interesting or inexpensive to eat except a couple of fast food places which do not stay open after about 4 PM on Sundays or pricey alternatives like Benihanas which is not fun alone. For some reason I seldom sleep well here and I have never figured out why.

Easy Stay. My boyfriend and I had been driving on PCH all day and stopped in Newport to have a few drinks. We had a few too many and decided it would be too risky to drive all the way home. Instead we googled a hotel and a great deal with Radison was brought up. I called and we were walking into our room a short 30 minutes later. The staff was friendly we basically walked in got to the room and had an incredible sleep on the comfortable beds. Thank you Radison for a comfortable and easy stay.
Simple stay. The room is nice and located close to the beach. Very clean and comfortable.

Bright and cheery. I had the VIP hotel experience. The staff were so helpful and the room was beautiful. I watched the sunset from my balcony. Everyone on staff were very eager to ensure I was comfortable. I was even looking for a local ice cream shop and the front desk gave me a few ideas and did not push room serviceThe downfall is that with the VIP reservation I was given the free breakfast buffet. Super right. When I went to use the coupon the first day for breakfast the waiter was excellent and made sure my coffee was full and I have everything I needed. The second day I had another waiter that asked if I had a coupon for the breakfast. My husband said we did and all of the sudden the waiter played the disappearing act. We did not get our coffee for a long time and I had to ask another server for it and cream. He was not even around for a refill. I suppose that he thought he would not get a tip because we did not pay for the breakfast. When he gave us the receipt and indicated to put our room number down he was very clear on where we would put how much we wanted to tip him. For a waiter that did not help at all he was undeserving of a tip however my husband did insist on leaving him a couple of bucks. I had come back and stay again as I am frequently in the area but I will not be eating there. Most of the staff the bright and airy atrium and facilities the sunset from my balcony. Go to the airport Fashion Island UCI and the beach. One staff member that could use some retraining.

Confidential Advocacy Training. The linen needs to be changed daily more shuttle services as well as a complimentary breakfast should be offered. In addition there were not very many incentives offered for restaurants in the area. The door servicemen were very nice and accommodating. The WIFI was a little difficult to figure out.

Nice but more dated that expected. We expected more modern convenience than what we found. The TV was inside the armoire which made it difficult to see from anywhere but the beds. There were very few outlets and the power strip was only four feet long so it came unplugged any time you pulled it out to access the plugs. The closet doors were difficult to open and the bathroom was small. The restaurant closes at 10 pm and housekeeping is not 24 hours so you can not get any coffee or condiments after that time. It was however clean conveniently located and the staff was pleasant. WiFi was included and there was no charge for self parking. I would stay there again but not at full price unles the rooms are updated. Also this hotel is heavily used by airline staff so the front desk is frequently busy with staff serving large groups of people at all hours. LocationWiFiSelf parking Close to airport. 1 12 hrs from Universal Studios. Shopping dining and entertainment nearby. Update and modernize the roms24hour housekeeping or Guest Services.

Radison Hotel. Very clean hotel. Nice staff. Excellent location. Fairly priced. No parking add on fees. Quiet rooms. Benihana is located in the parking lot nearby. Been staying here for years. Great for business trips. couples friends or just going solo. 5 6 min from the beautiful beaches of Newport and Laguna Beach. World class shopping just a few min away. Go and enjoy yourself. Stay more than 1 night because life is too short.

Average hotel. This is a clean hotel right next to the airport. I was concerned about noise but did not seem to bother us too much could be that we were just exhausted every night. The one negative was our shower. Possessed. One minute scalding the next Arctic. I had to jump out of the shower three times because the water would just turn scalding hot. No amount of adjusting would cool it down. Manager was not too concerned about the fact that I could have cracked my head open trying to escape the shower so hopefully my complaint will save someone else from the possessed showers at this hotel.
We stayed here to be close to Long Beach the next day to depart on a cruise. The hotel was clean. Plenty of parking. I have no complaints but it should be noted there is no continental breakfast.

hotel under renovation. Hotel under renovation which was not mentioned in ad. its like living in your home while you renovate it. Sometimes the elevators worked. cleaning staff excellent. I was in the bar attempting to get a coffee to go and noticed a staff meeting six people and two people in grey suits taking place. Not one of them came over to assist me. I left after waiting ten minutes. Customer service is clearly lacking in most departments. Hotel staff said room rates are going up September 01 good grief. Close to the airport. great restaurants bars within walking distance. You can renovate a hotel but without renovating the staff you are left with unhappy customers.

A pleasant surprise. The hotel is undergoing renovation which it needs. But even the old part of the hotel still open was very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. This hotel is right by the airport runway but the staff put us in a room on the MacArthur Blvd side where we could not hear the airport noise at all. Although the area is office and airport there are some really good restaurants a very short drive away. I would definitely stay again. The price was right and parking was free.

Was not impressed. This hotel was selected for me by my company so I figured it would be great but the whole place feels extremely outdated staff was just ok room service took over an hour and they put me in a room with a cry baby next door. I will probably have to stay at this hotel for work again but I will not be looking forward to it.

across the street from the airport. it was fine. i did nt realize it was right across the street from the airport though. i did nt like the check in area it was hard to get into. i ve been in worse and i ve been in better. there was airport noise so i probably would nt go back.
Hotel under construction. Air Conditioner sounds like a space shuttle launch. Hopefully the renovations make it worth it.
Everything was good except someone blasting music outside at 2 am.

Carlton Hyat. Pictures does not do justice for this hotel. Was called the Radison hotel and when you look up its closed. Same pics used for the Carlton. The outside looks like a hurricane hit it and the rooms date back to the seventies. Not of Hyat quality. One elevator for everyone to use takes 10 min. Felt like it was a motel 6. Not worth the money for all the noise outside of the airport next to them.

Horrible hotel. I had rented for 4 nights at this hotel and ended up checking out after the first night. The hotel was in horrible condition nothing like the photos. Staff was rude and not welcoming at all. I had reserved a room with one bedroom and got a standard room the assistant manager told me they did not have the room I had reserved. I checked out in the morning and found another hotel 4 minutes away which was amazing for almost the same price. I am constantly traveling and this is the WORST hotel I have ever stayed in.

Perfect for what we needed. Although the hotel is being renovated and that was annoying at times the hotel was everything we needed. Staff was superb and responsive rooms were perfect the restaurant though a bit hidden and down a corridor was wonderful and reasonably priced the location was great and we were close to everything we needed. They are clearly upgrading this property and it will be even nicer when done. Shuttle service was excellent. Mattresses were not quite firm enough for me.

Pretty decent business stay. The hotel is going through a construction phase but it did not bother me in any way. The room was bright spacious and comfy. Some of the furniture looked old but clean and functional. Bathroom was spacious enough also. The staff from the front desk to the dining and restaurant were all super friendly and helpful. The onsite restaurant looked nice so tried it for dinner. The food was excellent big portions and hit the spot. The paid internet was fast free with Hyat status and they have an airport shuttle every 30 mins.

Easy access to the airport. Easy to find. Rooms are clean and big TV. Bed is hard and so is their pillows. Had a headache from the super firm pillows. Keurig in the room with great soft towels. Great walk in shower. Clearly lit and no airplane noise at all with the windows closed. Other than the bed situation it is a good stay.

Great place to place for a short stay. Their Starbucks market was closed for renovation which was a little bummed about it. However there was a close store nearby however you had to drive. Booked this place for one night to go to a company work holiday party.

This is a very old property that was recently renovated. The pros. it is clean with comfortable beds and nice sized rooms. Cons it is not a five star hotel like the ratings on Expedia would suggest. This is no Four Seasons not even close but still a decent choice in Orange County where the only 5 star hotels are a good drive away in Laguna Beach. Front desk staff the bar the facilities in general are what you would expect at a second rate or even third rate Hotel. We got in late and all local restaurants were closed. So we decided to grab a snack in the hotel bar. Food was mediocre at best and service was rushed.

Freezing cold heated Pool. The hotel is modern and very clean. My biggest disappointment was that the heated Pool was freezing cold. Even kids were not getting in. We booked the hotel with the intention of swimming. All the desk personnel said was that they would let maintenance know.

My room was dirty and there were feces on my sheet. My room was dirty and there were feces on my sheets. The hotel manager offered to credit my account 50 for this day. When I escalated this to corporate they wanted to credit me for my whole stay but this particular hotel decline.
Little noise due to air traffic early morning and late at night.

We had a reservation for Friday and Saturday night. When we showed up they were experiencing power outage and were unable to check in the guests. Other Hayat regency nearby had room available but they would nt honor our reservation. We were forced to look for another hotel at 9 pm on Friday evening. Hotel had plenty of opportunity to figure things out but they opted out not to do anything.

This was the 2nd time I stayed at this Hyat as I loved it here the 1st time so decided to come again as there was a pricing special. The rooms hotel spaces are furnished and kept up well beautifully new and very modern. I did not use the restaurant or room service this time but previously both room service restaurant. the food was tasty with large portions with very attentive staff. The reception conceirge both times were very courteous with check in. However I was a bit put off slightly this 2nd time around as I was asking for late checkout as both receptionists I asked would only give me an hour as if you are a Hyat Rewards member you get till 2 pm. When I gave them my info which was correct online but for some reason NOT on their end of the Hyat database they could not find me. That was not the main beef but the receptionist was very adamant acting like I was NOT a Hyat rewards member and had to leave at 1. When I gave her my rewards number that finally worked but for some reason b c I was a new member that they signed me up for last time which was false she said I still had to leave at 1. She acted like she did not believe me nor was willing to accommodate. Then as I was waiting in the lobby before I was to depart the hotel the 2 young receptionists behind the counter were whispering and giggling about me it appeared. I am assuming b c of my inquiry. I have never had that happen at any hotel before. let alone a Hyat and was rather put off.

Not good or bad just an average property. Seemed to be remodeled fairly recently did n’t have old smell. Very cold as far as the aesthetic goes. Did the job probably would n’t stay there again unles price was exceptionally low.

Nice hotel close to beaches. Enjoyed our stay except housekeeping failed to complete their tasks each day had to call front desk everyday for missing items like towels coffee etc. Check in could be a bit easier. Overall nice hotel clean airplane traffic not a factor.
